com.cubeia.firebase.api.game.handler
Class AbstractTableActionHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.cubeia.firebase.api.action.visitor.DefaultActionVisitor
      com.cubeia.firebase.api.game.handler.AbstractActionHandler
          com.cubeia.firebase.api.game.handler.AbstractTableActionHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameActionVisitor, MttActionVisitor, Visitor, ActionHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
MttTableActionHandler, StandardTableActionHandler
public abstract class AbstractTableActionHandler
extends AbstractActionHandler

Default implementation of handling actions on a table.

Author:
Fredrik

seatingRules

protected SeatingRules seatingRules
Seating rules for the table, if not specified the DefaultSeatingRules will be used. Inject this.

Constructor Detail

AbstractTableActionHandler

public AbstractTableActionHandler(Table table,
                                  LobbyTableAccessor acc,
                                  DefaultLobbyMutator mut)
If the mutator given to this constructor is non-null it will be used to update the lobby data when a player leaves/joins.

Parameters:
table - Table for the handler, must not be null
acc - Lobby table accessor, may be null (only if "mut" is also null)
mut - Lobby mutator, may be null
Method Detail

getTable

public Table getTable()
Returns:
Returns the table.

requestActions

public void requestActions(Table table)

setPlayerReconnectTimeout

public void setPlayerReconnectTimeout(int millis)
Set the player reconnect timeout in milliseconds. Default value for this timeout is 2 minutes (120000 millis). If set to -1 the default value will be used.

Parameters:
millis - Timeout in millis, or -1 for default value

setPlayerReservationTimeout

public void setPlayerReservationTimeout(int millis)
Set the player reservation timeout in milliseconds. Default value for this timeout is 30 seconds (30000 millis). If set to -1 the default value will be used.

Parameters:
millis - Timeout in millis, or -1 for default value

the seatingRules

visit

public void visit(WatchAction action)
The correct return sequence should be: 1. WatchResponse 2. PlayerInfos 3. TableListener.notifyWatcherJoined
